content.title: Fonda NBO, a genuine Mexican “cantina”

introduction.small: In Nairobi, Fonda NBO offers a gastronomical round-trip to Mexico and its spicy recipes, in a typically Latin-American bistro.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Fonda NBO, a genuine Mexican “cantina”

paragraphs.text:
With its truly Mexican cantina style, rustic furniture and Latin earthenware hanged on red and yellow walls, it is hard to believe you are still in the heart of Nairobi, 15,000 kilometres away. Fonda NBO – in Mexico, fonda signifies bistro – stands out with dishes using traditional recipes reworked with local and often organic products, for the smallest carbon footprint possible.
Even if tacos, quesadillas and enchiladas are available, the shining stars are somewhat different: let the mole poblano surprise you, a chicken breast covered with a chocolate (or cocoa), sesame, plantain and tortilla crumb sauce. More than thirty different ingredients are being used to create this blend of complex flavours. If typical dishes have your preference, then order some hot peppers stuffed with marinated vegetables and Oaxaca, a Mexican cheese similar to mozzarella. A very exotic gastronomical journey!

Fonda NBO
Rosslyn Riviera Mall
Limuru Road
Nairobi

+254 735 053 829

fondanbo.com ﻿

Menu: around 2,000 KES

content.title: Boho Eatery, vegan world cuisine

introduction.small: In Nairobi, Boho Eatery offers a predominantly vegan menu, inspired by Malaysia, Mexico, Lebanon… food from around the world.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Boho Eatery, vegan world cuisine

paragraphs.text:
Green, lush and relaxing, Boho Eatery's garden is godsend during a long hot sunny day in Nairobi. Food lovers take up wicker chairs or hide under the ivy-covered pergola, seating on suspended white benches. This bohemian feel is also carried on inside, where plant-based decoration and furniture are reminiscent of the garden.
For all-day brunch or lunch, the short menu offers vegetarian and even vegan dishes, as well as a few meaty options. Between a falafel, hummus and marinated eggplant assortment, the beef brisket and cashew nuts Bliss Burger, and the laksa (Malaysian spicy noodle soup with chicken and tofu), these recipes will conquer a large customer base. For dessert, the creamy chocolate mousse and the coloured blueberry cheesecake – both vegan – will leave you with unforgettable memories.

Boho Eatery
60 Ndovu Road
Nairobi

+254 727 502 416

www.facebook.com/bohoeaterynairobi/ ﻿

Menu: around 2,400 KES

content.title: Funzi Island, the Kenyan paradise!

introduction.small: Immaculate beaches, endless stretches of sand, crystal clear waters… What else do we need?

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Funzi Island, the Kenyan paradise!

paragraphs.text:
Funzi Island is part of a small archipelago off the coast of Kwale County, south of Mombasa in the Indian Ocean. Laced with sandbanks and scattered about with some eco-lodges, the island welcomes you for some absolute relaxation. In this dreamlike place, nothing matters anymore but the sand's immaculate whiteness, licked by sparkles of blue water. Diving enthusiasts will be overwhelmed with so many exploration spots. Same goes for turtle lovers: the Chelonia mydas is a protected species that chose the area to reproduce.
What say you of a dugout canoe outing in the mangrove, or maybe a crocodile safari on the Ramisi River? Visit the village, home to 1,500 members of the Shirazi tribe, and take a lunch break to enjoy local cuisine. Let the sweet life entice you and discover the authentic natural heritage of Funzi Island.

content.title: Kitengela, glass and mosaic cottages

introduction.small: Discover a bohemian universe full of colour, just like its founder! Welcome to an enchanted village between art and nature!

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Kitengela, glass and mosaic cottages

paragraphs.text:
Located on the south bank of the Nairobi National Park, this atypical place is the work of the German artist Nani Croze who has been living in Kenya for more than 30 years.
In a labyrinth of mosaics, stained glass and iron sculptures, the Kitengala combines the magnificence of the local flora with art in its full glory. Built around a workshop and training centre where glassworks classes are taught, choose among six little cottages with evocative names (Glass House, Cat House, Mud Hut).
With patchwork quilts, wall coverings, rustic carpets and colourful furniture, as well as recycled glass, the effect is both welcoming and surprising but never breaks with the wild and natural surroundings. Even the pool area, punctuated with sculptures, perfectly illustrates the spirit of the place. At the Kitengela, you will be immersed in the powerful universe of this established artist known for her glass art.

Kitengela
P.O. Box 15563-00503
Mbagathi

+254 20 300 5126

www.kitengelaglassart.com/cottages/﻿

Rooms: from 6,000 KES

content.title: The Maasai Ostrich Farm, among the ostriches

introduction.small: Looking for a unique experience? A stay in this ostrich farm will leave you with unforgettable memories!

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The Maasai Ostrich Farm, among the ostriches

paragraphs.text:
These birds! They can taunt you and then run away very fast (at no less than 65 kilometres per hour, making them the fastest bipeds in the world). But when you return from your trip, you will be a sensation, when you tell stories of your stay in this unique place located in the heart of Happy Valley.
The Maasai Ostrich Farm, a simple and rustic place, retains the appearance of the ranch that this domain held in the past. You will sleep in one of five double rooms (with wooden beds and plaid blankets), or in one of ten tents carefully placed around the lake. The Honeymoon Tent and the Clouds Tent both have Jacuzzis with breathtaking views of the water and flamingos!

Maasai Ostrich Farm
P.O Box 24742-00502
Nairobi

+254 726 464546

www.maasaiostrich.com ﻿

Rooms: from 8,880 KES

content.title: Ngong House, the unsurpassed luxury of a lodge under the tree canopy

introduction.small: Amidst magnificent tree houses, these dream cabanas perched in trees, you will live like a prince.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Ngong House, the unsurpassed luxury of a lodge under the tree canopy

paragraphs.text:
From the balcony of your very luxurious Robinson Crusoe cabana, let the surrounding nature amaze you: the Ngong mountains, after which the lodge was named, welcome you.
Ngong House, the small private enclave of a Belgian diplomat that borders the Nairobi national park, is located just 15 minutes from the city centre. And yet what a surprise to discover in the middle of this luxuriant vegetation six marvellous tree houses on two levels! And if you prefer terra firma, you can opt for a room at the cottage located across from the pool or the suite in the main house.
Porcelain vases, a canoe-shaped bathtub, stained glass windows, canopy beds, linen sheets… refinement awaits all around. Don't miss the sunset over the Ngong Mountains, or a candlelight dinner prepared by the Kenyan chef and served at the foot of your tree house!

Ngong House
60 Ndovu Road
Nairobi

+254 20 251 3331

Rooms: from 16,500 KES

content.title: Sunday detox brunch at the Tin Roof Cafe

introduction.small: Pleasant spot in a calm setting, in the Karen district.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Sunday detox brunch at the Tin Roof Cafe

paragraphs.text:
Allow yourself some relaxing interlude in the heart of the Souk where you'll find the Tin Roof Cafe as well as an art gallery, a bookstore and a shop with designer pieces.
A charming spot opening onto a large patio, the Tin Roof pleases right away. Sit down at the bar, along the solarium or make the most of the small wooden tables in the garden with multicoloured chairs. On the large blackboard that serves as menu, you can see the daily specials prepared with organic and seasonal products: large salads, smoothies and little sandwiches too.
Check out the Polka Dot Art Gallery once you've had your meal and admire the jewellery creations of Sally Dudmesh, inspired by the Silk Road.

Tin Roof Cafe 
Dagoretti Road
Nairobi

+254 706 348 215

www.facebook.com/TinRoofCafe/ ﻿

Menu: around 1,700 KES

content.title: The sophisticated charm of the Fairmont The Norfolk

introduction.small: The hotel that welcomed Theodore Roosevelt and Karen Blixen knowns how to maintain its colonial style.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The sophisticated charm of the Fairmont The Norfolk

paragraphs.text:
A historical building dating to the early 20th century with tropical gardens, terraces, two swimming pools, popular restaurants, a fitness room and a perfect location in the heart of downtown, the Fairmont has top-end options with impeccable service. Opened in 1904, the hotel has retained the charm of yesteryear. The 170 rooms and suites with colonial or contemporary decor welcome you to the original building or the more modern extensions. Settle into the Lord Delamere terrace for an iced tea, taste the American-Kenyan cooking of the Tatu, one of the most sought-after spots of Nairobi, or relax in the subdued atmosphere of the Cin Cin Bar. Book your table for the famous Sunday Brunch that even offers pastry workshops for kids. Far from the tumultuous city, between tradition and modernity, the Fairmont is expecting you!

Fairmont The Norfolk
P.O. Box 58581-0200
Harry Thuku Road
Nairobi

+254 20 226 5555

www.fairmont.com/norfolk-hotel-nairobi﻿

Rooms: from 30,000 KES

content.title: The House of Waine, the warmth and elegance of a family home

introduction.small: Enjoy the soul of Africa at this unique hotel, where you will gladly set down your bags.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The House of Waine, the warmth and elegance of a family home

paragraphs.text:
This 4,000 sqm property, originally a family home, is located in the former coffee plantation of Karen Blixen. Comfort and a warm welcome are reflected in this setting of refined simplicity. Here the heritage of the past is mixed with more contemporary pieces in a perfect balance with wood, upholstered furniture and well-chosen lights.
Charm abounds in the ten rooms and one suite: luxurious decoration that is both up-to-date and colonial, truly exquisite. To immerse yourself in the calm of the hotel, far from the madding city, take a walk in the tropical park and make the most of the superb pool on the property. Settling into the House of Waine will make you feel like you've come home.

House of Waine
Lane Karen
Nairobi

+254 733 414 215

www.houseofwaine.com ﻿

Rooms: from 39,000 KES

content.title: Jockey Club, an air of Nairobi's jet set

introduction.small: Ngong Race Course and Golf Park elegantly welcomes you, with a sense of friendliness that honours the one and only race track club of Eastern Africa.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Jockey Club, an air of Nairobi's jet set

paragraphs.text:
In Nairobi, horse races represent more than just a sporting event followed by horse enthusiasts as well as occasional and die-hard gamblers. As a matter of fact, each race, be it modest or an important show, offers people a chance to gather with family or friends.
Between two steeplechases, you'll be entertained with traditional dance performances and music shows, warming up an already quite hot atmosphere. Regularly updated on Jockey Club's website, the race calendar offers a new competition almost every Sunday.
Since 2003, the Ngong Race Course and Golf Park has been equipped with a golf course where a whole new generation of athletes train under the watchful eye of seasoned players. If you're a lover of the small white ball, indulge in an unforgettable moment on the green of this beautiful course surrounded with palm trees that overlooks the Ngong mountains.

Ngong Race Course and Golf Park
P.O. Box 40373
Nairobi

+254 722 414 598

www.jockeyclubofkenya.com

content.title: Lake Victoria, 68 100 sq km of sheer beauty

introduction.small: The biggest lake of the African continent shelters the treasures of a lost paradise.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Lake Victoria, 68 100 sq km of sheer beauty

paragraphs.text:
The second biggest stretch of freshwater on earth after Lake Superior in North America, Lake Victoria is also the fourth largest in the world.
From Nairobi, access the town of Kisumu on the northeast tip of the lake in a twin-engine plane. The flight is an incredible introduction to the marvel that awaits you. You may also reach the area by train – expect a 15-hour ride – with breathtaking landscapes along the way. It will also be an occasion to cross the Great Rift Valley!
With sublime treks amid yellow oleander, discovery of a remarkable prehistorical site that looms 562 metres over the lake, or even boat excursions, there are many possible options to visit this inland sea. You'll witness local fishermen who do not miss an opportunity to fish for the Nile perch in a calm and blissful setting.

content.title: Champagne Bar at the Sankara, classy!

introduction.small: Opt for a succulent dinner followed by a glass on the seventh floor terrace.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Champagne Bar at the Sankara, classy!

paragraphs.text:
On the 7th floor of the five-star Sankara hotel in Westlands, the Champagne Bar welcomes you in a cosy setting with wood panelling and furniture designed by Marc van Rampelberg.
In this cocoon, with gold and ebony hues echoing the carefully selected bottles, enjoy the exceptional Krug or Taittinger champagnes, champagne cocktails or single malt whiskeys. You can have your pick, all in moderation of course.
Comfortably seated in front of the large bay window, enjoy the breathtaking view for an elegant pause. Orchestrated with similar refinement, your dinner at the Artisan Restaurant will prepare you for a nightcap. Its cuisine, light and of high quality, promises all the flavours of Africa. To continue your evening after 1 am, walk over to the Sarabi Pool & Supper Club, with its stunning rooftop terrace and bar under the open sky.

Sankara
Woodvale Grove
Westlands
Nairobi

+254 20 420 8000

www.sankara.com﻿

Menu: around 1,200 KES

content.title: Mama Oliech, the hidden table

introduction.small: An off-the-beaten-path spot, highly sought after by regulars and fish lovers alike.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Mama Oliech, the hidden table

paragraphs.text:
Located in Kilimani, a stylish neighbourhood about 15 minutes from downtown Nairobi and not far from the Yaya Shopping Center, Mama Oliech has built a solid reputation for simple goodness at affordable prices, all in a warm and welcoming atmosphere. Like Mark Zuckerberg, the founder of Facebook, many rush to get a spot at the large wooden tables protected from the sun by large awnings.
On the menu, choose the fried tilapia, a fish from Lake Nakuru, served whole with succulent side dishes: ugali, the traditional staple food of East Africa, made with flour cooked in water, or kachumbari, a spicy salad typical of Kenyan cuisine that is made with tomatoes and onions. At Mama Oliech, you will meet many office workers, but also visitors for the day, irresistibly attracted by the scent of this generous and authentic cuisine.

Mama Oliech Restaurant
Marcus Garvey Road
Nairobi

+254 723 925604

www.facebook.com/MAMA-Oliech-Restaurant

Menu: around 1,100 KES

content.title: Mama Ashanti, the taste of Ghana

introduction.small: To spice up your trip, taste the fiery dishes of Ghanaian cuisine!

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Mama Ashanti, the taste of Ghana

paragraphs.text:
Encouraged by the success of his first restaurant in Uganda, Kwame Nana Boateng, a Ghanaian who spent 20 years in London, decided to try his luck with the gourmets of Nairobi. A bet he won hands down! With peppers and chillies of all kinds, traditional West African cuisine cultivates the art of tasty and fiery combinations. Mama Ashanti will make your taste buds dance to honour traditional Ghanaian cuisine: egusi (African pistachios), goat soup, plantains… every dish has its own character. To taste them all, take a seat in the spacious garden under the pergola or a parasol with the rhythm of a soundtrack meticulously chosen from the major movements of African music playing in the background. You will be impressed by the endearing simplicity of this place where ties to West Africans are kept alive. Kenyans come to this popular meeting spot for the love of Ghanaian cuisine that Kwame often prepares himself.

Mama Ashanti
Muthangari Gardens Road
Nairobi

+254 736 222 324

www.facebook.com/mamaashantiKE/ ﻿

Menu: around 2,000 KES

content.title: Mfangano Island Camp, right on the beach

introduction.small: Escape to the heart of Lake Victoria, on an island cut off from the world and a hotel made up of small huts.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Mfangano Island Camp, right on the beach

paragraphs.text:
If you feel the need to get away, the Mfangano Island hotel is a great choice. You can make believe you are an adventurer crossing the calm waters of the great lake on which dhows – traditional boats – can be seen sailing with their traditional white sails.
Mfangano is only a camp in name, as the services on offer are only the best. Each hut has a charming interior and a small private veranda. You will be so close to the lake, separated by just a few rocks and flowers that you can relax in symbiosis with the cormorants, pelicans and other water birds whose slow and gentle fly-bys will punctuate your day. The high point of the evening is dinner set upon a table on the pontoon, in the setting sun with a few oil lamps to light the dishes. You will be served products just picked from the hotel's own gardens and fresh fish of the day.

Mfangano Island Camp
Lake Victoria
Mfangano Island

+254 20 273 4000

www.governorscamp.com/property-descriptions/mfangano-island-camp-lake-victoria

Rooms: from 24,000 KES

content.title: A long-distance motorcycle race in the “cradle of humankind”

introduction.small: Wake up the biker in you and take on the Great Rift Valley!

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: A long-distance motorcycle race in the “cradle of humankind”

paragraphs.text:
It takes about eight days – as well as a lot of dust and stamina – to embark on this extraordinary odyssey, starting in Nairobi and taking you through the Great Rift Valley in the north of Kenya. For lovers of immersive journeys, the “cradle of humankind” is filled with hominid fossils and archaeological remains. As for motor sports enthusiasts, they will feel like living their own Paris-Dakar race.
As you go along, your eyes will feast on majestic and changing landscapes: lakes, volcanic mountains, savannas, deserts… This itinerary will guide you to the shores of Lake Turkana to meet the most ancestral ethnic groups of Africa. Whether you pick a lodge, a bungalow or a bivouac, the experience will be complete, surprising and unique, the kind you have once in a lifetime.
Other routes are worth considering, like for instance the one that goes all the way to the wild coast on the Indian Ocean, the Kilimanjaro Maasai trail also to the Indian Ocean or the Northern Lakes tour.

+254 780 030 430

www.motorbike-safari.com/en/

content.title: The Alchemist Bar, for successful chemistry!

introduction.small: In the evening air and with music pumping, jump into the heart of the lively Nairobi nights.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The Alchemist Bar, for successful chemistry!

paragraphs.text:
The Alchemist Bar, located in the classy Westlands neighbourhood, mixes hip hop rhythms with funk and soul played by African DJs late into the night. In the large outdoor area with heteroclite decor, wooden crates serve as coffee tables alongside soft couches covered in African fabrics. Opt for a cocktail prepared by the best mixologists of the capital and dance to the music of the DJs' mixes. If you are feeling hungry, you can even dig into the “best hamburger of Nairobi”.
Fashionable visitors interested in art, music and food gather around the counter. You can meet the next generation of local artists at regularly occurring evening events with dance performances or documentary projections and even a food truck with delicious little snacks. Not to be missed!

The Alchemist Bar
Parklands Road
Nairobi

+254 727 591116

www.facebook.com/AlchemistBar254/ ﻿

Menu: around 1,000 KES

content.title: The markets paint a live picture of Nairobi

introduction.small: Inhabitants come for food and visitors for a walk. Colours, scents… in the covered and outdoor markets, you'll feel the city's heart beat as one.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The markets paint a live picture of Nairobi

paragraphs.text:
Magic works like a charm as you step in City Market, one of Nairobi's famous covered markets located in the triangle formed by the corner of Market, Muindi Mbingu and Koinange streets. It offers stands of produce, flowers, meat and crafts spreading as far as the eye can see under the surprising ceiling of the construct built in 1930 near the railway tracks of the time.
To better appreciate traditional Kenyan art, head to the Maasai market on the edge of town. It will be hard to resist temptation there: colourful sisal bags, bright tone clothing, finely weaved wall coverings, not mentioning big and large coloured pearl necklaces. And don't forget that bargaining is very much the usage here!
Finally, Dagoretti Road's Souk in the Karen district will satisfy your most eclectic cravings as far as high-end craftsmanship and contemporary art go.

City Market
Muindi Mbingu Street
Nairobi

+254 722 984538

www.nairobi.go.ke/

Maasai Market
Slip Road
Nairobi

The Souk
Dagoretti Road
Nairobi

www.bkenya.com/the-souk/

content.title: Brew Bistro, a drink with a panoramic view

introduction.small: For one of the most impressive sunsets and the best nightlife.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Brew Bistro, a drink with a panoramic view

paragraphs.text:
Two addresses on Ngong Road and Westlands and one recommendation: get there quick! Whichever you choose, you can enjoy Brew Bistro's homemade beer, the best in the region and one that will please all aficionados. On Ngong Road, the younger crowd comes for the fabulous brunch available every day of the week between 11 am and 4 pm. Classic dishes like smoked salmon and subtly reinvented eggs benedict are on the menu.
For a nightcap, the Westlands welcomes you on the Fortis Tower roof terrace, with large armchairs and couches inviting you to relax. With jazz playing in the background, it is time for cocktail hour to begin, before you sit down overlooking Nairobi to taste some delicious burgers.

Brew Bistro Ngong Road
Piedmont Plaza
671 Ngong Road
Nairobi

+254 719 648 138

Brew Bistro Westlands
Fortis Tower
Mpaka Road
Nairobi

+254 705 466 836

www.thebigfivebreweries.com/ ﻿

Menu: around 1,500 KES

content.title: Talisman, the restaurant in Nairobi

introduction.small: “The best restaurant in Nairobi” as proclaimed by the New York Times' Spirited Traveller. Don't wait to make your reservation!

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Talisman, the restaurant in Nairobi

paragraphs.text:
This very fashionable “gastrolounge” owes its reputation as much to its menu as to its elegant and luxurious setting. Sumptuous candlelit gardens invite you to a romantic dinner, while the dining room with its benches scattered with large cushions offer a deliciously refreshing pause. Here, on the road to Ngong in the Karen district, you will find a subtle touch of elegance and comfort. The fusion cuisine, mixing European, Asian and African savours, is skilfully orchestrated. Taste the feta samosas with cilantro served with chilli pepper jelly, the teriyaki tofu with ginger or the bhajia-style steak and potatoes with wasabi sauce. Your taste buds will not soon forget the experience. The “classics” menu is served alongside a “seasonal” option, all created with fresh products, including organic vegetables from the restaurant's garden.

Talisman
320 Ngong Road
Nairobi

+254 705 999997

www.thetalismanrestaurant.com ﻿

Menu: around 2,700 KES

content.title: Hell's Gate, between heaven and hell

introduction.small: Hell's Gate references the fabulous red cliffs and the scorching heat that prevails. A visit under pressure!

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Hell's Gate, between heaven and hell

paragraphs.text:
An excursion to Hell's Gate will undeniably be one of your nicest experiences during your stay in Nairobi. Hell's Gate is actually among the very few national parks to allow you free access, whether you choose to visit by foot, bike or car. Surprise and close encounters with buffalos, impalas and giraffes will make your day.
Do not miss the famous Fisher Tower, an impressive deep red rock formation that was used in the 1950 movie King Solomon's Mines, with Stewart Granger and Deborah Kerr. Continue the excursion with a detour through the Ol-Njorowa Gorge near the Olkaria volcano, of which fumaroles still blow and witness of its current activity! It is recommended to leave before 10 am in order to enjoy some of the morning's coolness – and make sure you're accompanied with a local guide. Just remember to look up in the air and catch the flight of various birds of prey hovering over this “diabolically” beautiful park.

www.kws.go.ke/content/hells-gate-national-park

content.title: The Lord Eroll, the taste of France with an English backdrop

introduction.small: A good dose of French cuisine, a drop of Kenyan joie de vivre, and an ounce of British accent: the perfect recipe!

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The Lord Eroll, the taste of France with an English backdrop

paragraphs.text:
Feel like some escargots bourguignon or perhaps a bit of smoked salmon? Cheese fondue? Or crêpes Suzette? All in a refined and privileged setting? The Lord Eroll, whose name bears tribute to a young aristocrat of the 19th century, is here to meet the cravings of expatriates and other aficionados of fine French cuisine.
The colonial-style house, the lounge decorated with Chesterfield sofas, the Highlander Bar with its tartan carpet and the huge park in which the establishment sets its tables for events will all plunge you into the atmosphere of a week-end in the middle of the Victorian countryside.

Founded in 1980, this institution has maintained its nobility with impeccable service, a showcase of French refinement. The establishment even received the prestigious World Luxury Restaurant Award in 2017!

The Lord Eroll
89 Ruaka Road
Nairobi

+254 721 920820

www.lord-erroll.com

Menu: around 5,000 KES

content.title: A fantastic wildlife reserve at the gates of the city

introduction.small: Created in 1946, the Nairobi National Park gives you an unrivalled chance to see wildlife animals, only a few hundred metres away from the metropolis.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: A fantastic wildlife reserve at the gates of the city

paragraphs.text:
Once you leave the modern comfort of your hotel, it only takes a few minutes to cross the city centre and reach the national park. There, you'll witness a natural spectacle of buffalos, leopards, giraffes, monkeys, antelopes, hippos and rhinos roaming freely. During an impressive and highly immersive promenade on the suspended Nairobi Safari Walk, you'll get a sense of the surrounding fauna and flora's absolute richness.
At the eastern tip of the reserve, make sure to take a detour by the elephant's orphanage of the David Sheldrick Willdlife Trust. This pioneering organisation works on protecting wild species and welcoming young pachyderms. A few more kilometres to the east, make a stop at the Giraffe Centre, a “sanctuary” that allows endangered Rothschild giraffes to reproduce. Within just a few years, it saw about 50 adult animals being reintroduced to various national parks throughout the country.

Nairobi National Park
Langata Road
Nairobi

+254 20 602 121

www.kws.go.ke/parks/nairobi-national-park

Nairobi Safari Walk
Langata Road
Nairobi

+254 20 237 9407

www.kws.go.ke/content/nairobi-safari-walk

Giraffe Centre
Duma Road
Nairobi

+254 20 807 0804

www.giraffecenter.org

The David Sheldrick Wildlife Trust - Elephant Orphanage
Magadi Road
KWS Central Workshop Gate, off
Nairobi

+254 20 230 1396

www.sheldrickwildlifetrust.org

content.title: The Tribe, the hippest hotel in Nairobi

introduction.small: With its service and decor that combines modern and African styles, this brand new boutique hotel has already won many hearts.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The Tribe, the hippest hotel in Nairobi

paragraphs.text:
The Tribe purposefully opened in the Gigiri district, the diplomatic area of the capital, just 25 kilometres from the airport. Businessmen, well-to-do travellers and locals make up the demanding clientele. You will recognize the unique signs of Job Harbottle when you walk into the lobby among immense armchairs with curved backs and statuettes placed on shelves.
The 137 rooms of comfortable proportions showcase African and contemporary styles. The spa, fitness centre and reading room with over 2,000 books will provide options for your free time. The rooftop terrace with cosy chairs and ottomans is a hit! More than a luxury hotel, with very modern decor and 900 museum-quality African art pieces meticulously staged, the Tribe offers you a stay in an unparalleled atmosphere.

The Tribe
The Village Market
Gigiri
Nairobi

+254 20 720 0000

www.tribe-hotel.com ﻿

Rooms: from 30,000 KES

content.title: Kenya or Kilimanjaro mountain? Reach new heights!

introduction.small: You will need to catch your breath and be tough to climb up the highest and most beautiful Kenyan peaks, but the feeling up there is well worth the effort…

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Kenya or Kilimanjaro mountain? Reach new heights!

paragraphs.text:
The highest peaks of Mount Kenya and Mount Kilimanjaro stand respectively tall at 5,199 and 5,891 metres. If you feel like a certified trekker in your heart and soul, you will surely want to beat these two emblematic African summits. Even if you choose only to climb up only one, the thrill will remain the same.
Second highest peak in Africa, Mount Kenya stands out with its snowy crests. The spectacular rugged terrain and valleys filled with high altitude lakes give it amazing character. Little visited compared to its Kilimanjaro counterpart, it is located only 140 kilometres north of Nairobi.
The other giant rises in the northeast of Tanzania, about 200 kilometres from the Kenyan capital. There, forests lead to plains before you can try and cross over the dark slopes of this mountain chain, including three dormant volcanoes. Globe-trotter adventurers and seasoned hikers, we'll see you on top of Africa!

content.title: Kenyatta International Conference Centre, Nairobi's first skyscraper

introduction.small: Set out for a visit of the third highest building of the city, a symbol of its 1970s futurist architecture.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Kenyatta International Conference Centre, Nairobi's first skyscraper

paragraphs.text:
With a tower looking like a sculpture of a thousand and one brown petals and an amphitheatre accommodated in an impressive hut inspired by traditional African shacks, the 105-metre high Kenyatta International Conference Centre, or “KICC”, is among the country's most emblematic constructs. Conceived by architect Karl Henrik Nøstvik in 1974, it welcomes the general assemblies of the National Senate as well as important international conferences. Visitors from all around the world squeeze in to visit this iconic location in Nairobi. Enter the atrium, as cascading luxurious vegetation falling into large and clear water ponds draw a striking picture for you as light shines in. Climb up to the 26th floor where a revolving gastronomic restaurant offers unobstructed views of Nairobi and beyond. When the sky is clear, you can see Kenya's faraway mountains… and even the Kilimanjaro itself!

Kenyatta International Conference Centre
Harambee Avenue
Nairobi

+254 20 326 1000

www.kicc.co.ke

content.title: Touch the skies!

introduction.small: Safari in a private plane, skydiving, hot-air balloon… Flying dreams to discover Kenya from up high!

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Touch the skies!

paragraphs.text:
Enjoy the landscapes' majesty in the national parks and indulge in a getaway up in the sky. You can book an excursion tailored to your needs with Air-Adventures, as pilot Alexis Peltier will carry you on board his private plane leaving from Nairobi. Choose a package, from one to several days and get ready for intense discoveries.
Fly over the plains of the Maasai Mara booking and give in to the steadfast charm of a hot-air balloon ride. Alternately, if you own a pilot's license, you may rent a small airplane at Nairobi's Aero Club near the city centre for a private flight. And finally, if thrills are what you're looking for, opt for a paragliding experience over the Solaj and Subukia valleys or the Lake Elementaita. Go crazy with a sky dive over the Kenyan shores near Mombasa. Before jumping off, you'll discover the reef's sumptuous beaches and crystal clear waters.

Aero Club of East Africa
P.O. Box 40813
Nairobi

+254 733 832 488

www.aeroclubea.com/

Governor's Balloon Safaris
Little Governors' Camp
Maasai Mara National Reserve

+254 20 273 4000

www.governorsballoonsafaris.com/

Air-Adventures
Wilson Airport
Nairobi

+ 254 722 998 315

www.air-adventures.fr

Skydive Diani
Diani Beach Road
Diani
Ukunda Coast

+254 701 300 400

www.skydivediani.com

content.title: Little Governors Camp, lunching with the elephants

introduction.small: Athletes travel here and the stay itself will provide some unforgettable memories.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Little Governors Camp, lunching with the elephants

paragraphs.text:
The adventure begins with your arrival on a small landing strip in the African bush. Picked up by a minibus, you'll arrive at the famous Mara River that you will cross in a small boat. Then you will cross a forest amid the Maasai Mara reserve. Soon you'll catch a glimpse of a clearing in the middle of which 17 luxury tents await in the shadow of the trees with wooden terraces and beautiful bathrooms. As for the decor, the tents are understated and exquisite.
The camp is open to the surrounding lands so it is not rare to see elephants at lunchtime! The reception area and bar are relaxing places to be at nightfall, after a dinner served under the magnificent tent set up for this event. Take a seat before the camp fire under the stars and let yourself dream away.

+254 20 273 4000

www.governorscamp.com/property-descriptions/governors-camps-masai-mara/little-governors-camp﻿

Rooms: from 30,000 KES

content.title: Crescent Island sanctuary

introduction.small: As a bird reserve, this island of Lake Naivasha is one of the few authorized promenades on foot in Kenya.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Crescent Island sanctuary

paragraphs.text:
No other place quite looks like Crescent Island, a crescent-shaped peninsula located less than 100 kilometres away from Nairobi on Lake Naivasha. One of the rare freshwater lakes of the Great Rift Valley, it can be accessed by road or by boat.
As you come near, flocks of birds move and sing in a deafening hurly-burly of a scene, as the majestic Mount Longono stands in the faraway distance. Pelicans, cormorants and eagles bunch up to the shores, but you'll also be able to make out hippos, giraffes, buffalos and zebras on land. Predators are non-existent here, making it possible for you to walk around on foot, with a proper guide. You may also be lucky enough to see albino Grants gazelles, whose fur brightened up over generations, due to the lack of felines in the area.

Crescent Island
P.O. Box 16
Naivasha

www.crescentisland.co/

content.title: Face-to-face with giraffes at the Giraffe Manor

introduction.small: Petting the nose of a giraffe at breakfast? You're not dreaming, you really are in Nairobi!

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Face-to-face with giraffes at the Giraffe Manor

paragraphs.text:
One of the most unique hotels on the planet is to be found in the heart of the Kenyan capital, less than an hour from the international airport. Just imagine a magnificent colonial building in stone with climbing ivy… and a troop of Rothschild giraffes! Welcome to the Giraffe Manor, which is in the midst of a nature reserve.
One of the 12 rooms of this majestic 1930s building will be your home-away-from-home, with fine wood work, cast iron staircases and canopy beds. During your stay, live in harmony with the giraffes that roam freely in the park. At your table, you can even share a meal with these impressive creatures when they approach, interested in seeing what is happening inside the house. They'll even stretch their necks through the windows that are intentionally left open! Here the rubberneckers are on the other side of the fence!

Giraffe Manor
Gogo Falls Road
Nairobi

+254 725 675 830

www.thesafaricollection.com/properties/giraffe-manor/﻿

Rooms: from 57,000 KES

content.title: The Mara River wildebeest migration, magic of the animal kingdom

introduction.small: The wildebeest from the Serengeti press on to cross the Mara River, offering a breathtaking animal show, unique in the world!

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: The Mara River wildebeest migration, magic of the animal kingdom

paragraphs.text:
You can visualise a quiet place, where a few hippos bask in the mud under the sun. However, during the great migration, an entirely different show takes place. Looking for new pastures and guided by their instinct, thousands of zebras, gazelles and wildebeests migrate from North to South between the Serengeti National Park in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara, the African nature reserve that shelters the highest density of animals in the entire world. From July to September, the Mara River is the last obstacle in their way to greener pastures.
Experience the spectacle of animal life to the closest in a 4x4 vehicle, as survival of the fittest remains the rule. If you want some rest and comfort, make a stop in Tanzania at the sumptuous Singita Faru Faru Lodge, looking like an African cabinet of wonders and offering one of the best wine cellars of the country. Simply gorgeous!

Singita Faru Faru Lodge
Grumeti Reserves
Serengeti National Park
Tanzanie

+27 21 683 3424

www.singita.com/lodge/singita-faru-faru-lodge/

content.title: Hemingways, between old Europe and the New World

introduction.small: With the allures of an English club, the Hemingways bar welcomes you during your tasting or for a whole evening of elegance.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Hemingways, between old Europe and the New World

paragraphs.text:
In the magnificent room with heavy drapes of the well-named Hemingways, the Chesterfield couches, fireplace and Italian marble surround a sublime bar with subdued lighting. On the menu, you can choose from an extraordinary selection of the best whiskeys, but also a multitude of cocktails from yesterday and today. Choose the Pink Platinum, a vodka, cranberry and champagne cocktail or the eponymous Hemingways Martini with cardamom and hazelnut liquor, a splash of lemon syrup and gin with pineapple juice – all in moderation of course. You will also have access to a large choice of wines and champagnes from the New World and old Europe, a wise blend of sophistication and exoticism. To relax, head to the terrace for its comfortable wicker armchairs.

Hemingways Nairobi
Mbagathi Ridge
Nairobi

+254 20 229 5012

www.hemingways-collection.com

Menu: around 700 KES

content.title: African Heritage House, a tribute to African art

introduction.small: The “most photographed house of Africa” is also the largest Pan-African art collection.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: African Heritage House, a tribute to African art

paragraphs.text:
In the middle of nowhere, you'll notice a red mass and a small oasis of greenery overlooking Nairobi's national park. It is definitely there, amid peace and quiet, that you will find the African Heritage House. Inspired by Djenné's Mosque, this majestic building, listed as national historical monument, intrigues as much by its history as by the treasures it shelters. Its owner Alan Donovan imagined and had it built in 1972. A fervent enthusiast of African art and culture, he invites you to an inner journey. From the Nigerian desert to the mosques in Mali, from Congo to Kenya, his art collection will dazzle you: 6,000 items, sculptures and weavings await you, from the roughest to the most precious.
How about extending that privileged moment spent among riches of the past and present? Book one of the very comfortable and absolutely unique rooms, decorated in the indigenous style of the house.

African Heritage House
Mombasa Road
Mlolongo

+254 721 518 389

www.africanheritagehouse.info/portfolio-item/african-heritage-house/

content.title: Ayatana Wellness, yoga training to be born again in Kenya

introduction.small: Indulge in a little break, where body and mind come as one, with a backdrop of unaltered wilderness.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Ayatana Wellness, yoga training to be born again in Kenya

paragraphs.text:
What about taking advantage of your Kenyan stay to simply enjoy feeling deliciously good? The Avatana Wellness association not only offers classic yoga lessons, but it also organises hideaways of two to three days, near the capital and all around Kenya.
Thanks to the relaxation and meditation lessons, this retreat will help you focus on yourself and find balance in your life. Whether you're a beginner or seasoned yogi, you may also access tailored sessions during which a private teacher will take care of you. From Lamu to Lake Turkana, you will discover the huge benefits of practicing yoga, amid wild yet peaceful landscapes.

+254 720 673 147

www.ayatana.co.ke

content.title: Serengeti and Tsavo East, Kenya's jewels

introduction.small: Travel to the heart of wild paradises and expect spectacles from another era in East Africa's two most renowned national parks.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Serengeti and Tsavo East, Kenya's jewels

paragraphs.text:
Listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Centre, the Serengeti (meaning “endless plains”) National Park overlaps on Kenya and Tanzania. The Tsavo East one, created in 1948, is one of Kenya's biggest and oldest parks.
Numerous lodges have been set up as starting points for safaris, during which you'll discover legendary beasts: zebras, gnus, impalas, giraffes, elephants, lions, cheetahs, leopards, rhinos and many others…
The Serengeti plains, 250 kilometres south of Nairobi, welcome thousands of migrating animals looking for fresh pastures. And the red land of Tsavo East is just as impressive! The landscapes found in this park, 420 kilometres east of Nairobi, are full of contrasts, sprinkled with acacia trees and crossed by the Galana River. It offers one of Africa's most popular safaris. Welcome to the land of elephants and red zebras!

Tsavo East National Park

+254 800 597 000

www.tsavopark.com

Serengeti National Park

+255 27 250 3471

www.serengeti.org

content.title: Laikipia Park, a diamond in the rough

introduction.small: Large and somehow preserved from extensive tourism, Laikipia majestically spreads over 9,500 sq kilometres. It deserves your full-fledged attention.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Laikipia Park, a diamond in the rough

paragraphs.text:
Here, no lodges or mass tourism! The region indicates the frontier with the desert areas up north. It is surrounded by the Aberdare Range in the south, Mount Kenya in the southeast, Maralal region in the north and the Great Rift Valley in the west. Extraordinary landscapes appear one after the other, from savannas to the large plains of the north and south territories, and the tropical forests in the east. The Lew Wildlife Conservancy fights to promote responsible tourism and offers a slew of activities compatible with the respect of nature.
Between a stop in Timau, the spectacle of a waterfall in Nyahururu, a foot trek and some horseback riding, take some time for a safari in the Aberdare National Park.
Traces of past ranches can still be seen, remnants from the various waves of British settlers who arrived from 1907 onwards. Their modern counterparts welcome a small number of visitors and make sure they'll perfectly integrate the ecosystem.

Lew Wildlife Conservancy
Private Bag
Isiolo

+254 64 313 1405

www.lewa.org/

content.title: Mombasa, from the old town to Africa's most beautiful beaches

introduction.small: Between land and sea, the capital city of the south coast has a lot to offer. Get ready for the sweet life.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Mombasa, from the old town to Africa's most beautiful beaches

paragraphs.text:
If you're looking for a bit of history and a lot of summer softness, Mombasa will answer both favourably, only 440 kilometres southeast of Nairobi, in the deep waters of two estuaries of the Indian Ocean.
The Fort Jesus citadel, built in the 17th century by the Portuguese, the Swahili-styled Basheikh Mosque and the Shree Cutch Satsang Swaminarayan Hindu Temple all witness to the city's rich past.
The white sandy beaches of the coral coast spread over 530 kilometres, interspersed with coconut and mango trees as well as… beach huts! In Diani Beach (one of the most popular), there's no shortage of activities: water skiing, diving, deep-sea fishing, sailing… Enjoy a delicious fish dish at Ali Barbour's Cave, then find nice souvenirs at the Zanzara shop. Finally, you should not hesitate stepping in the Beach Art Gallery, a great way to discover the country's upcoming generation of artists.

Ali Barbour's Cave Restaurant
Ali Barbours Road
Diani Beach

+254 714 456131

www.alibarbours.co/

Diani Beach Art Gallery
Bahari Plaza Shopping Center
Diani Beach Road
Diani Beach

+254 706 629 655

www.kenyaafricanart.com/

Zanzara Boutique
Bahari Plaza Shopping Center
Diani Beach Road
Diani Beach

+ 254 40 320 2360

www.dianishopping.com/

content.title: Savage Wilderness Camp, ultimate adventure

introduction.small: On the program: rafting, rock climbing, hikes and treks. Get on board for the big thrill!

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Savage Wilderness Camp, ultimate adventure

paragraphs.text:
Far from luxurious lodges and traditional safaris, the Savage Wilderness Camp allows you to reacquaint yourself with adventure! Located about one hour from Nairobi near the town of Sagana, this camp is among the local key spots for lovers of various “challenges” in a sporting and familial setting.
Take your pick between the four kinds of activities being offered: water, mountain, camp and team-building based, the latter being perfect to develop your kids' team spirit.
Will you go for a rafting or kayak trip on the Tana River? Or do you prefer climbing? Either way, hang tight! On the camp side, the list gets long: bungee jumping, zip-lining and archery. Crank up the intensity of the experience and stay for a few nights in one of the cottages by the river (adorned with two swimming pools). Comfort is secondary, but the adventurer in you cares of no such things!

Savage wilderness safaris camp
Savage Wilderness
P.O. Box 1000
Sarit Centre
Nairobi

+254 737 835 963

www.savagewilderness.org

content.title: Meeting the Maasai people

introduction.small: Immerse yourself in a Maasai village for an invaluable encounter based on sharing.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Meeting the Maasai people

paragraphs.text:
The Maasai country spreads between the Kenya and Kilimanjaro mountains, by the Maasai Mara booking, famous for the density of its animal population. The Maasai live between these two geographical symbols. Out of respect for this nomadic people who have been able to maintain their traditions, we strongly urge you to favour ecotourism. The Maasai Mara Village champions the concept: part of the dividends from the visits (KES 7,000 per day, including guide, meals and activities) goes to the SEMADEP Community Development Foundation that actively supports the Maasai community.
Small groups of 2 to 10 visitors are allowed in the village at a time. As you open up to the inhabitants' lifestyles and customs, you will make your way from enkang to enkang, those typical oval-shaped houses made of the village's mud and branches. Wait no longer and meet this wonderful people of dignified and warm farmers, wearing their famed chequered gowns, as they always happily and wilfully welcome their guests.

+254 72 181 7757

www.maasaimaravillage.com

content.title: Karen Blixen Museum, in the footsteps of author Karen Blixen

introduction.small: Karen Blixen wrote: “I had a farm, at the foot of the Ngong hills”. Since 1986, fans of the writer have gather to visit this place, turned into a museum.

mainPicture.accessibilityDescription: Karen Blixen Museum, in the footsteps of author Karen Blixen

paragraphs.text:
A few kilometres away from Nairobi, you will find the farm of Danish author Karen Blixen (1885-1962), whose book Out of Africa was adapted into a movie in 1985. The house, built in colonial style and surrounded with bougainvillea flowers, has been preserved in its original state, allowing you to gleefully wander around furniture and items gathered and loved by the ancient owner.

In the garden that backs onto the forest, a table made of stone stands out in the middle of giant acacia trees and cacti. Built with a grindstone, it used to be on the spot where Karen Blixen gathered the employees of her coffee plantation every morning.

Not far from the museum, several locations now take on the prestigious name, including the capital's oldest golf course, a restaurant where to enjoy Swahili prawns, as well as the Karen Blixen Coffee Garden that welcomes you in Baron Blixen's old hunting lodge.

Karen Blixen Museum
Karen Road
Nairobi

+254 208 002 139

www.museums.or.ke/karen-blixen/

Karen Country Club
Karen Road
Nairobi

+254 733 606 950

www.karencountryclub.org

Tamambo Karen Blixen
Karen Road
Nairobi

+254 719 346 349

www.tamarind.co.ke

Karen Blixen Coffee Garden Restaurant & Cottages
336 Karen Road

+254 733 616 206

www.karenblixencoffeegarden.com
